block.p: Miriam H. Kim, the daughter of Huicha and Shinyol Kim of Basking Ridge, N.J., was married yesterday in Bernardsville, N.J., to Ming Chang Shih, the son of Joyce Chang Seprish of Rockaway, N.J., and Dr. Shawn Shih of Nei-Li, Taiwan. The Rev. Peter G. Hofstra performed the ceremony at the First Presbyterian Church of Bernardsville.

Mrs. Shih, 26, is a financial analyst in investment research for Goldman, Sachs & Company in New York. She graduated magna cum laude from Rutgers University. Her parents own and manage Kim's Cleaners, a dry cleaning business in Irvington, N.J.

Miriam H. Kim, the daughter of Huicha and Shinyol Kim of Basking Ridge, N.J., was married yesterday in Bernardsville, N.J., to Ming Chang Shih, the son of Joyce Chang Seprish of Rockaway, N.J., and Dr. Shawn Shih of Nei-Li, Taiwan. The Rev. Peter G. Hofstra performed the ceremony at the First Presbyterian Church of Bernardsville.

Mrs. Shih, 26, is a financial analyst in investment research for Goldman, Sachs & Company in New York. She graduated magna cum laude from Rutgers University. Her parents own and manage Kim's Cleaners, a dry cleaning business in Irvington, N.J.

Mr. Shih, 28, is a project manager in electronics and high tech with Andersen Consulting, in New York. He graduated from Johns Hopkins. His mother is a senior scientist at Roche Molecular Systems, a research division of the pharmaceutical company, in Branchburg, N.J. His father is a professor of chemical engineering and physics at the Yuan-Ze Institute of Technology in Tao-Yan Shian, Taiwan. The bridegroom is the stepson of George Seprish.
